intro: Roebuckiella cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf roebuckiella, is a flowering plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Roebuckiella cuneata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
